questions.question_text: Which two objects could a Discount Schedule be applied to and take precedence over the Discount Schedule identified in a Product Feature? (Choose two.)

comments.content:
Yes, as described in https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=000382771&type=1. 

Description
The lookup to a Discount Schedule exists on 5 different objects in Salesforce CPQ as related to Quote Lines. Only a single Discount Schedule will be applied to any given Quote Line even if multiple related objects point to different discount schedules. The information below describes how CPQ selects the discount schedule to use on a Quote Line in this scenario:
Resolution
The SBQQ__DiscountSchedule__c field on the Quote Line will be populated in accordance from the following hierarchy:
Contracted Price
Price Dimension (MDQ)
Product Option
Product Feature
Product 

The order for these objects and the priority follows the numbering. For example, should the Discount Schedule lookup be populated on both the Product Option (#3) and the Contracted Price (#1), the lookup on the Contracted Price would be take precedence and be applied to Quote Line.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AC
I believe A and C are correct.

choices.A: Set the Component checkbox to True on the add-on Product record.
choices.C: Create a Product Feature record referencing the add-on Product.
choices.B: Set the Customer Community Availability picklist on the add-on Product to Never.
choices.D: Create a Product Option record referencing the add-on Product for each bundle.

questions.question_text:
Universal Containers has an add-on Product that can only be sold as part of bundles.
Which two steps should the admin take to meet this requirement? (Choose two.)

Universal Containers (UC) has rolled out a new product, Warranty, priced as 10% of all the hardware products on the Quote. After Implementing, UC realizes that the price is calculating a percentage of the prices before discounts have been applied, whereas UC actually wants it to reflect the discounted prices.
Which field should UC update to ensure the pricing is correct to meet the requirement?

choices.C: Update Percent of Total (%) on the hardware products to 10.
choices.A: Update Percent of Total Base on Warranty to Net Price.
choices.B: Update Percent of Total Target on Warranty to Standard Warranty.
choices.D: Update Percent of Total Category on the hardware products to Hardware.

questions.question_text:
An admin wants the user to have the ability to choose options and define option quantity via bundle configuration.
Which three values for Configuration Type will meet this requirement? (Choose three.)

Universal Containers (UC) sells two fixed-priced subscriptions (Products A and B) and one Percent Of Total subscription Product (Product C), which is calculated as a percentage of the List total of Products A and B. Both Products A and B are marked as 'Include in Percent Of Total'. UC also wants to enable ramping of quantities and pricing for all three Products on a yearly basis.
Which solution should the admin use to meet the requirement?

choices.D: Set the Percent Of Total Target to Product C for Products A and B.
choices.B: Use Quote Line Groups for each annual term and set the Percent Of Total Scope on Product C to Group.
choices.C: Add Products A, B. and C to the Quote for the desired Quote Subscription Term.
choices.A: Implement a Quote Calculator Plugin (QCP) to aggregate Products A and B by segment.

discussion.content: not a fan of any of these answers - I generated the quote in my trailhead org using Multi-Dimensional Quoting - whenever we see anything about 'ramping' or 'year-over-year', that points to an MDQ solution using Price Dimensions
